Race.SpecificTitle: PW Fantasy Sports -- Authorize Fantasy Sports Contests - Act 322, 2018
Race.SummaryText: PROPOSITION TO AUTHORIZE FANTASY SPORTS CONTESTS.
Race.FullText: Shall fantasy sports contests be permitted in the parish of Orleans?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District -- $400 Parcel Fee Renewal - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans renew the levy of the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District's ("District") annual Parcel Fee, not to exceed four hundred dollars ($400) per year on each parcel of taxable real property located within the District, which is that area of the City of New Orleans specified in Resolution R-18-48 of the New Orleans City Council, for a period of four (4) years, commencing January 1, 2019 and ending December 31, 2022, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $110,000 annually, to be used for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the Lake Oaks Subdivision, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Kenilworth Improvement Dist. -- $225 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans impose and collect a fee upon each parcel, defined as a lot or lots upon which only one main house is situated, located within the Kenilworth Improvement District, which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within the following boundaries: the mid-line of Morrison Road on the South, New Castle Street on the West, including parcels on both sides of the street, Wales Street on the North, including parcels on both sides of the street that have municipal addresses on Wales Street, and the mid-line of Mayo Road on the East, not to exceed two hundred twenty-five dollars ($225) for a term of and not to exceed eight (8) years, beginning January 1, 2019 and ending December 31, 2026, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $190,000 annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote, encourage, and enhance the security, beautification, and overall betterment of the District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Bullard Neighborhood Improvement Dist. -- $350 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Lake Bullard Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans impose a fee upon each improved parcel of land in the Lake Bullard Neighborhood Improvement District (District), which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within the following boundaries: Bullard Avenue, Dwyer Road, Berg Canal, and Lake Forest Boulevard, not to exceed three hundred fifty dollars ($350) for a period of eight (8) years, beginning January 1, 2019 and ending December 31, 2026, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $98,000 annually, to be used solely and exclusively for promoting and encouraging the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the District, except a 1% City collection fee, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided by the New Orleans Police Department?
